sen.j: カラスミ（鱲子）は、魚の卵巣を塩漬けし、塩抜き後、天日干しで乾燥させたもの。
sen.e: Karasumi is a food product made from fish roe, which is salted down firstly and then dried by the sunlight after some of the salt was removed in water.
Karasumi is a food product made from fish roe, which is first salted down and then sun-dried after some of the salt is removed in water.
Karasumi is a food product made from fish roe, which is first salted down and then sun-dried after some of the salt is removed in water.

sen.j: 日本ではボラを用いた長崎県産のものが有名だが、香川県ではサワラを用いる。
sen.e: Karasumi produced in Nagasaki Prefecture using mullet roe is famous in Japan, while Karasumi produced in Kagawa Prefecture using Japanese spanish mackerel roe is also known.

The Karasumi produced in Nagasaki Prefecture using mullet roe is famous in Japan, while the Karasumi produced in Kagawa Prefecture using roe of Spanish mackerel caught in the fishing grounds of Japan is also known.

The Karasumi produced in Nagasaki Prefecture using mullet roe is famous in Japan, while the Karasumi produced in Kagawa Prefecture using roe of Spanish mackerel caught in the fishing grounds of Japan is also known.

sen.j: 日本以外でも台湾やイタリアのサルデーニャ島、スペイン、エジプトでも作られる。
sen.e: Besides Japan, Taiwan, Sardinia island in Italy, Spain and Egypt also produce Karasumi.
Besides Japan, Taiwan, Spain, Egypt and the Italian island of Sardinia also produce Karasumi.
Besides Japan, Taiwan, Spain, Egypt and the Italian island of Sardinia also produce Karasumi.

sen.j: ヨーロッパでは他の海水魚の卵巣も用いられる。
sen.e: Other sea fish roe are also used in Europe.
The roe of other ocean fish are also used in Europe.
The roe of other ocean fish are also used in Europe.

sen.j: ウニ、ナマコ文化的側面と併せて、日本三大珍味と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: Karasumi is often dubbed "Japanese three major dainty" along with sea urchin and salted entrails of trepang.
sen.cmt: 文化的側面の意味がわからずwebをひいたところ，ウニ，コノワタになっていましたので訂正して書きました。
sen.e: Karasumi is often dubbed one of the "three major Japanese delicacies," along with sea urchin and salted entrails of trepang.
Karasumi is often dubbed one of the three major Japanese delicacies, along with sea urchin and salted entrails of trepang.

sen.j: ねっとりとした塩分の濃いチーズのような味わいは、高級な肴として珍重される。
sen.e: Tasting like sticky and salty cheese is valued highly as a high-class accompaniment to a drink.
Its flavor, which is similar to sticky, salty cheese, is highly valued as a high-class accompaniment to drinks.
Its flavor, which is similar to sticky, salty cheese, is highly valued as a high-class accompaniment to drinks.

sen.j: 薄く切り分けてオードブルに供したり、すりおろして酢を混ぜてからすみ酢にしたりして使用する。
sen.e: Karasumi is served in various ways such as one item of an hors d'oeuvre by slicing thinly and Karasumi-vinegar by mixing with vinegar after being grated.
Karasumi is served in various ways, including as an hors d'oeuvre by slicing it thinly and as Karasumi-vinegar by grating and mixing it with vinegar.
Karasumi is served in various ways, including as an hors d'oeuvre by slicing it thinly and as Karasumi-vinegar by grating and mixing it with vinegar.

sen.j: 名前の由来はその形状が中国製の墨、すなわち唐墨に似ている所から付けられたというのが定説になっている。
sen.e: It is generally believed that the name of "Karasumi" is derived from a block of sumi (ink stick) imported from China for its resembled appearance.
It is generally believed that the name "Karasumi" is derived from a block of sumi (ink stick) imported from China, based on the similarity of appearance.
It is generally believed that the name "Karasumi" is derived from a block of sumi (ink stick) imported from China, based on the similarity of appearance.

sen.j: ボラの腹を注意深く切り開き、卵巣の膜を切らないように取り出す。
sen.e: After cutting mullet's belly open carefully so as not to incise the membrane covering the roe, take mullet roe out.
The mullet's belly is carefully cut open so as not to incise the membrane covering the roe, and then the roe is removed.
The mullet's belly is carefully cut open so as not to incise the membrane covering the roe, and then the roe is removed.

sen.j: ていねいに水洗いし、1尾分の卵巣に食塩を塗りつけ、樽で3-6日漬ける。
sen.e: After washing it with water politely, smear the salt on it and pickle it in a barrel for 3 to 6 days.
After washing it with water gently, smear it with salt and pickle it in a barrel for three to six days.
After washing it with water gently, smear it with salt and pickle it in a barrel for three to six days.

sen.j: 樽から出して水洗いし、真水を満たした半切桶に入れる。
sen.e: Take it out from the barrel, and then, put it in a flat large tub filled with fresh water.
Remove it from the barrel, and then place it in a large, flat-bottom tub filled with fresh water.
Remove it from the barrel, and then place it in a large, flat-bottom tub filled with fresh water.

sen.j: 一昼夜後に水中で揉んで軟らかさを確かめる。
sen.e: Check the softness by hand in water after a whole day and night.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Check the softness by hand in the water after an entire day and night.
Check the softness by hand in the water after an entire day and night.

sen.j: どの部分も軟らかになっていれば塩抜きを終わる。
sen.e: If every part of the roe became soft, take it out from the water.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: If every part of the roe has become soft, take it out of the water.
If every part of the roe has become soft, take it out of the water.

sen.j: この時の塩加減が味を左右するといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that the saltiness at this stage would affect the ultimate taste.
It is said that the saltiness at this stage will ultimely affect the flavor.
It is said that the saltiness at this stage will ultimately affect the flavor.

sen.j: 斜めにした板の上にならべ、その上に板を載せ、5段ほどにして加圧する。
sen.e: Putting the roe side by side on an inclined board, apply pressure by piling about five boards on it.
Place the roe side by side on an inclined board, and then apply pressure by piling about five boards onto them.
Place the roe side by side on an inclined board, and then apply pressure by piling about five boards onto them.

sen.j: 水気を抜いて翌日日乾しにし、夜間は再び積み重ねる。
sen.e: Dry the partially dehydrated roe by the sunlight next day, and pile those boards on it again in the nighttime.
Sun-dry the partially dehydrated roe the next day, and when night arrives pile the boards on it again.
Sun-dry the partially dehydrated roe the next day, and when night arrives pile the boards on it again.

sen.j: 表面に浮き出る脂を拭き取りながら、約10日間の天日干しを繰り返して仕上げる。
sen.e: Manufacturing of Karasumi would be finished after repeated solar drying for about ten days with wiping the grease coming to the surface.
The Karasumi production process is complete after about ten days of sun-drying, during which the oil that rises to the surface should be wiped away.
The Karasumi production process is complete after about ten days of sun-drying, during which the oil that rises to the surface should be wiped away.

sen.j: からすみは古くからギリシャ・エジプトに産し、塩漬けにして食膳に上がっていた。
sen.e: Karasumi had been produced in Greece and Egypt since long ago, which was salted down to eat.
Karasumi has been produced in Greece and Egypt since long ago, being salted down for consumption.
Karasumi has been produced in Greece and Egypt since long ago, being salted down for consumption.

sen.j: 日本には江戸時代の初期に中国より長崎に伝来したといわれている。
sen.e: It is believed that Nagasaki was the first city in Japan that Karasumi was imported from China in the beginning of Edo period.
It is believed that Nagasaki was the first city in Japan to which Karasumi was imported from China; this occurred at the beginning of the Edo period.
It is believed that Nagasaki was the first city in Japan to which Karasumi was imported from China; this occurred at the beginning of the Edo period.

sen.j: 歴史的なからすみに関する文献としては、豊臣秀吉が食したというものがあるとされている。
sen.e: As a historical document relating to Karasumi, a document with a description that Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ate Karasumi apparently exists.
As a historical document pertaining to Karasumi, there is a document that apparently states that Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ate Karasumi.
As a historical document pertaining to Karasumi, there is a document that apparently states that Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ate Karasumi.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期の文献では、慶安元年1648年10月19日夜に信濃国佐久郡岩村田の割元職の篠澤佐五右衛門良重が小諸城主青山因幡守宗俊公に料理等を献上した記録がある。
sen.e: In the document compiled in the early Edo period, there is a record that an official liaison (warimoto) Sagoemon-yoshishige SHINOZAWA in Iwamurata, Saku County, Shinano Province donated materials including dishes to Munetoshi AOYAMA, Inaba no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) as well as the lord of Komoro Castle in 1648.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the document, compiled in the early Edo period, there is a record stating that an official liaison (warimoto) Sagoemon-yoshishige SHINOZAWA in Iwamurata, Saku County, Shinano Province, donated materials (including dishes) to Munetoshi AOYAMA, Inaba no kami (the governor of Inaba Province), as well as the lord of Komoro Castle in 1648.

In the document, compiled in the early Edo period, there is a record stating that an official liaison (warimoto) Sagoemon-yoshishige SHINOZAWA in Iwamurata, Saku County, Shinano Province, donated materials (including dishes) to Munetoshi AOYAMA, Inaba no kami (the governor of Inaba Province), as well as the lord of Komoro Castle on the night of December 3, 1648.

sen.j: その中に「からすみ」の文字がある。
sen.e: A word of "Karasumi" exists in the record.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The record contains the word "Karasumi."
The record contains the word "Karasumi."

sen.j: 当日からすみは、足打（折敷）という木製の器に盛られて提供されている。
sen.e: Karasumi was served by being displayed on a four-legged wooden tray called Oshiki on that day.
Karasumi was served that day, being displayed on a four-legged wooden tray called "Oshiki."
Karasumi was served that day, being displayed on a four-legged wooden tray called "Oshiki."

sen.j: この文献は子孫の篠澤明剛氏が所有しているが、現在は佐久市立望月歴史民族資料館にて一般公開されている。
sen.e: This document belongs to his descendant Akiyoshi SHINOZAWA, which is open to the public at Saku Municipal Mochidzuki City Museum of History and Folklore at present.
This document, which belongs to his descendant Akiyoshi SHINOZAWA, is currently open to public viewing at Saku Municipal Mochidzuki City Museum of History and Folklore.
This document, which belongs to his descendant Akiyoshi SHINOZAWA, is currently open to public viewing at Saku Municipal Mochizuki City Museum of History and Folklore.

sen.j: 中国からの伝来当時より鰆の卵で作られていた。
sen.e: Karasumi had been made from Spanish mackerel roe since it was first imported from China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Karasumi had been made from Spanish mackerel roe since it was first imported from China.
Karasumi had been made from Spanish mackerel roe since it was first imported from China.

sen.j: 延宝三年（1675年）、高野勇助が長崎県・野母崎方面でよく捕れる鯔の卵で製造することを案出した。
sen.e: Yusuke TAKANO invented the manufacturing method of Karasumi in 1675 by using mullet roe which was caught in large quantities in the Nomozaki district, Nagasaki Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Yusuke TAKANO created the Karasumi production process in 1675 by using the roe of mullet, which were caught in large quantities in the Nomozaki district of Nagasaki Prefecture.
Yusuke TAKANO created the Karasumi production process in 1675 by using the roe of mullet, which were caught in large quantities in the Nomozaki district of Nagasaki Prefecture.

sen.j: 日本以外でのカラスミ
sen.e: Karasumi in other countries
Karasumi in other countries
Karasumi in other countries

sen.j: 台湾では「烏魚子」（北京語：ウーユーツ、台湾語オーヒージー）という。
sen.e: In Taiwan, Karasumi is called "U-yu-tsu" in the Beijing dialect of Chinese and "O-hi-ji" in Taiwanese.
In Taiwan, Karasumi is called "U-yu-tsu" in the Beijing dialect of Chinese and "O-hi-ji" in Taiwanese.
In Taiwan, Karasumi is called "U-yu-tsu" in the Beijing dialect of Chinese and "O-hi-ji" in Taiwanese.

sen.j: 台湾での食べ方は表面の薄い膜を剥ぎ取ってから、酒を表面に軽く塗り、弱火で裏表を一、二分ずつ繰り返し火あぶり、表面が白くぶつぶつになるまでかりかりに焼き上げる。
sen.e: Stripping a thin membrane covering the surface of the roe, Taiwanese puts a small amount of sake on it and roasts both sides of the roe on a low flame repeatedly for a few minutes until the surface becomes crispy with white eruptions.

Stripping away the thin membrane covering the surface of the roe, the Taiwanese puts a small amount of sake on it and roasts both sides of the roe over a low flame for a few minutes until the surfaces become crispy and show white eruptions.

Stripping away the thin membrane covering the surface of the roe, the Taiwanese puts a small amount of sake on it and roasts both sides of the roe over a low flame for a few minutes until the surfaces become crispy and show white eruptions.

sen.j: 出来上がったら、薄くスライスして食べる。
sen.e: After that, the roasted roe is served by slicing thinly.
After that, the roasted roe is served thinly sliced.
After that, the roasted roe is served thinly sliced.

sen.j: ダイコンまたはネギと一緒に爪楊枝で刺して食べられる事が多い。
sen.e: Taiwanese often eat it with white radish or spring onion by piercing them with the toothpick.
Taiwanese often eat it with white radish or spring onion by piercing the pieces with a toothpick.
Taiwanese often eat it with white radish or spring onion by piercing the pieces with a toothpick.

sen.j: 焼いたものを夜店の屋台でも売っている。
sen.e: The roasted roe is also sold at stands in the night stall.
The roasted roe is also sold at stands in the night stalls.
The roasted roe is also sold at stands in the night stalls.

sen.j: イタリアでは、イタリア語でボッタルガ（Bottarga）またはボタルゴ（enBotargo）という。
sen.e: Karasumi is called "Bottarga" or "enBotargo" in Italy.
Karasumi is called "bottarga" or "enbotargo" in Italy.
Karasumi is called "bottarga" or "enbotargo" in Italy.

sen.j: ボッタルガは必ずしもボラの卵巣だけを使用するのではなく、タラやマグロなど他の海水魚の卵巣を利用するものもある。
sen.e: Bottarga is made not only from mullet roe but also from other sea fish roe such as cod roe and tuna roe.
Bottarga is made not only from mullet roe but also from the roe of other ocean fish such as cod and tuna.
Bottarga is made not only from mullet roe but also from the roe of other ocean fish such as cod and tuna.

sen.j: ほぐして、パスタにあえて食べる例が多い。
sen.e: Italian often eats Bottarga by mixing with pasta after flaking it.
Italians often eat bottarga by flaking it and then mixing it with pasta.
Italians often eat bottarga by flaking it and then mixing it with pasta.

sen.j: 類似した料理に日本のたらこスパゲッティがある。
sen.e: Japan has a similar dish called "Tarako spaghetti" (spaghetti mixed with cod roe).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Japan has a similar dish called "Tarako spaghetti" (spaghetti mixed with cod roe).
Japan has a similar dish called "Tarako spaghetti" (spaghetti mixed with cod roe).

sen.j: この料理の起源はキャビアのスパゲティであり、ボッタルガスパゲティではない。
sen.e: The origin of Tarako spaghetti is spaghetti mixed with caviare, not spaghetti mixed with Bottarga.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Tarako spaghetti originated as spaghetti mixed with caviare instead of being mixed with bottarga.
Tarako spaghetti originated as spaghetti mixed with caviare instead of being mixed with bottarga.

sen.j: 東地中海沿岸ではメゼの一品として親しまれている。
sen.e: In the eastern Mediterranean, Karasumi is popular as a dish of the meze.
In the eastern Mediterranean, Karasumi is popular as a dish of the meze.
In the eastern Mediterranean, Karasumi is popular as a dish of the meze.
